lead_paragraph: The National Labor Relations Board has challenged some parts of the employee contracts at the hedge fund Bridgewater Associates, including the confidentiality agreement.

byline.original: By ALEXANDRA STEVENSON and MATTHEW GOLDSTEIN

headline.main: Labor Board Challenges Secrecy in Wall Street Contracts

snippet: The National Labor Relations Board has challenged some parts of the employee contracts at the hedge fund Bridgewater Associates, including the confidentiality agreement....
abstract: National Labor Relations Board files pending administrative action against Bridgewater Associates for interfering with, restraining and coercing employees from exercising their rights due to provisions in their employment contracts; agency was spurred to action when former Bridgewater employee Christopher Tarui withdrew sexual harassment complaint after firm agreed not to enforce two-year noncompete clause; investigation is expected to result in new regulations regarding employment contracts.
